activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas L Paulson

records.addlTxt:
11:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lucas L Paulson appeared by video.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Lucas L Paulson. 
Attorney Firkus states DE waives preliminary hearing. 
Court questions DE. 
The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.
Court finds probable cause and binds over. 
If next hearing is a plea, must be in person. Otherwise may appear by zoom.
Arraignment scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:09 PM Defendant Lucas L Paulson in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Lucas L Paulson.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Firkus requests time limits waiver regarding preliminary hearing be continued. Parties may appear by Zoom Video to next hearing. Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 11:45 am.
AMENDED.  Attorney Dan Firkus appointed.  $25.00 per month starting 11/25/2022.
Letter to Judge Bitney from Attorney Harrington requesting to withdraw and appointing new counsel
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:31 AM Defendant Lucas L Paulson appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Lucas L Paulson.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court relates. 
Attorney Harrington relates and requests preliminary hearing, waives time limits and waives further reading of the complaint.
Next hearing to be in person.
Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Andrew Harrington (now) appointed.  Repay $25.00 per month starting 11/25/2022.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Will wait to send OIW (per blue form) until JA advises on the new attorney appointed.
Attorney Laura Sutton to be repaid at the rate of $25.00/month to begin 11/25/22.

10:35 AM Defendant Lucas L Paulson in court.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

10:36  court relates and gives appearances.
Court will have JA appoint counsel for defendant.
New date set; may appear by zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with co-defendant K. B.

10:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lucas L Paulson in court. 

Defendant wishes to seek private counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
